name: Wish
description: Wish is the mightiest spell a mortal can cast. By simply speaking aloud, you can alter reality itself. The basic use of this spell is to duplicate any other spell of level 8 or lower. If you use it this way, you don't need to meet any requirements to cast that spell, including costly components. The spell simply takes effect. Alternatively, you can create one of the following effects of your choice: Object Creation, Instant Health, Resistance, Spell Immunity, Sudden Learning, Roll Redo, or Reshape Reality. The stress of casting Wish to produce any effect other than duplicating another spell weakens you. After enduring that stress, each time you cast a spell until you finish a Long Rest, you take 1d10 Necrotic damage per level of that spell. This damage can't be reduced or prevented in any way. In addition, your Strength score becomes 3 for 2d4 days. For each of those days that you spend resting and doing nothing more than light activity, your remaining recovery time decreases by 2 days. Finally, there is a 33 percent chance that you are unable to cast Wish ever again if you suffer this stress.

spellOptions.name: Duplicate Spell
spellOptions.description: Duplicate any other spell of level 8 or lower. You don't need to meet any requirements to cast that spell, including costly components. The spell simply takes effect.

spellOptions.name: Object Creation
spellOptions.description: You create one object of up to 25,000 GP in value that isn't a magic item. The object can be no more than 300 feet in any dimension, and it appears in an unoccupied space that you can see on the ground.

spellOptions.name: Instant Health
spellOptions.description: You allow yourself and up to twenty creatures that you can see to regain all Hit Points, and you end all effects on them listed in the Greater Restoration spell.

spellOptions.name: Resistance
spellOptions.description: You grant up to ten creatures that you can see Resistance to one damage type that you choose. This Resistance is permanent.

spellOptions.name: Spell Immunity
spellOptions.description: You grant up to ten creatures you can see immunity to a single spell or other magical effect for 8 hours.

spellOptions.name: Sudden Learning
spellOptions.description: You replace one of your feats with another feat for which you are eligible. You lose all the benefits of the old feat and gain the benefits of the new one. You can't replace a feat that is a prerequisite for any of your other feats or features.

spellOptions.name: Roll Redo
spellOptions.description: You undo a single recent event by forcing a reroll of any die roll made within the last round (including your last turn). Reality reshapes itself to accommodate the new result. You can force the reroll to be made with Advantage or Disadvantage, and you choose whether to use the reroll or the original roll.

spellOptions.name: Reshape Reality
spellOptions.description: You may wish for something not included in any of the other effects. State your wish to the DM as precisely as possible. The DM has great latitude in ruling what occurs; the greater the wish, the greater the likelihood that something goes wrong. This spell might simply fail, the effect you desire might be achieved only in part, or you might suffer an unforeseen consequence as a result of how you worded the wish.
